result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca J Haseltine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must sign up for probation at the Rice Lake location by Monday, January 18, 2016

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no contact with Travis T.  Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: AMENDED 2/22/18:  COURT ORDERS 10 DAYS CONDITIONAL JAIL WITH WORK RELEASE FOR FAILURE TO COMPLETE COMMUNITY SERVICE.  JAIL TIME TO BE SERVED ONCE DEFENDANT IS APPREHENDED ON THE BENCH WARRANT.

1-11: Text messages
12- Photo of meth
13 - CD of controlled buy
14- Bag with tin 
15- Bag with meth 
16- Confidential Crime Lab Report

Defendant Rebecca J Haseltine in court with attorney James H Krave.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 8:25: Court calls case outside presence of the jury to discuss voir dire.
S. Millermon, Clerk - 8:30: 20 jurors seated.  8:33 All jurors sworn.  Court voir dire.  9:06 State voir dire.  No voir dire by defense.  Peremptory strikes made.  Court gives preliminary jury instructions.  9:20 12 jurors sworn and then excused to make phone calls, etc.  9:20 Motions for impeachment for prior conviction of defendant - 3 convictions.  Travis T. - 10 convictions.  9:23 Court recesses. 
C.Smith, Clerk - 9:48: Jury seated. State makes opening statement. 9:54: Defense makes opening statement. 10:01: T.T. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. Exhibit 1 - 11: Text messages. Exhibit 12: Photo of methamphetamine. 10:15: Cross by Defense. 10:21: Redirect by State. 10:22: Detective Jason Hagen with Barron Co Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 13: CD from controlled buy. Exhibit 14: Bag with tin. Exhibit 15: Plastic bag with methamphetamine. 10:46: Cross by Defense. 10:50: Redirect by State. 10:50: School Resource Deputy David Kuffel with the Barron Co Sheriff's Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. Exhibit 16: Confidential Crime Lab Report. 10:59: Cross by Defense. Exhibit 17: Report of Detective. 11:05: Forensic Scientist Michelle Gee called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibits 1-16 offered by State and received by Court. 11:17: Jury excused. Court recesses. 11:25: Court goes back on the record outside the presence of the jury. Court questions Defendant about her right to testify. Defendant waives right to testify. Court accepts Defendant's waiver. Parties review jury instructions with the Court. 11:37: Jury seated. Court gives jury instructions. 11:50: Jury excused for lunch. 11:51: Court recesses. 12:37: Court resumes. 12:40: Jury seated. State makes closing argument. 12:50: Defense makes closing argument. Court gives final jury instructions. 1:00: Jury excused for deliberation. 1:26: Jury seated. Jury finds the Defendant guilty. 1:28: Jury excused. Court accepts Jury's verdict and enters a Judgment of Conviction today's date. Court orders PSI. Defendant to report by 3:00 p.m. on Thursday. Bond continues. Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.
